channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Republicans score victory in Georgia fight over election observers, RNC chairman says
item.description: Republicans are celebrating after accusing four blue counties of not allowing election observers into additional weekend sites for absentee ballot sub...

item.title: The Trump Flex
item.description: The promise and perils of a confident campaign.

item.title: Trump detours to Virginia, encourages AG Jason Miyares to open investigation into Rep. Nancy Pelosi
item.description: Former President Donald Trump on Saturday detoured from his tour of battleground states on the last weekend before election day to Virginia, where he ...

item.title: Female swimmers who fought Roanoke College over transgender athlete back Trump at rally
item.description: Former President Donald Trump received a shout-out from a group of female swimmers who pushed back after their college gave a spot on the team to a bi...

item.title: After RNC Lawsuit Extended ‘On-Demand’ Mail-In Voting, Bucks County Pennsylvanians Still Faced Massive Lines
item.description: The Trump campaign and the RNC sued to extend 'on-demand mail-in voting,' but voters still waited in lines until hours after the deadline had passed.

item.title: Abortion supporters at Women's March in Boston turn out in droves to support Harris presidency
item.description: Abortion supporters participated in the Woman's March in Boston, Massachusetts ahead of Election Day in a strong show of support for Vice President Ka...

item.title: Media Run Blatant Election Interference With Propaganda About Trump ‘Threatening’ Liz Cheney
item.description: Democrats and the media aren’t just lying about what Trump said; they’re rigging the vote with a mass psy-op days before the election.

item.title: Shock poll has Harris leading Trump in Iowa with 3-point shift toward vice president in red state
item.description: VP Harris leads former President Trump narrowly in the final Des Moines Register Iowa poll, three days ahead of the election in a seven-point reversal...

item.title: Trump’s ‘Chickenhawk’ Attack on His GOP Critics Is Dumb, but Not Evil
item.description: Far from being craven warmongers, Liz Cheney, John Bolton, and other Republicans Trump and his supporters loathe advocate stable deterrence.

item.title: How the J6 Case Could Fuel an Effort to Block Trump from Office If He Wins
item.description: Would Democrats use Jack Smith’s case as a trigger for invoking the insurrection disqualification at a joint session of Congress?

item.title: The Era of Soft Campus Despotism Is Far from Over
item.description: Even if DEI may be on its way out, the political culture that reigns on campus today remains a threat to the mission of the university.

item.title: Leftist Group Threatens Michigan Voters: ‘We Will Be Reviewing’ Your Voting Record
item.description: The left-wing Voter Participation Center sent Michigan residents, including a reporter for The Federalist, letters with threatening language.

item.title: Complaint Alleges As Many As 500 Ballots Were Dumped In A Milwaukee Drop Box
item.description: CPAC filed a complaint alleging illegal ballot harvesting and possible 'fraud or corruption in the voting process.'

item.title: America Isn’t Free As Long As Its Press Is Subservient To The Democrat Party
item.description: Civil society requires an honest media to report information about its government truthfully and fairly to the people.

item.title: Are Federal Arts Programs Worth the Money?
item.description: Candidates haven’t weighed what works and what doesn’t.

item.title: Nearly 200 families separated by U.S.-Mexico border reunite briefly in annual event
item.description: Nearly 200 families gathered Saturday along a stretch of the U.S.-Mexico border for heartfelt but brief reunions with loved ones they had not seen for...

item.title: Trump reflects on end of campaign, and the end of his rallies
item.description: Former President Donald Trump on Saturday said that he was "sad" that his rallies, one of the staples of his campaign, were coming to an end.
